title: Fix mobile sidebar overlap with slide-out menu

requirements.text: On mobile screens (below md breakpoint), hide the left sidebar by default so it does not overlap the main dashboard content. Add a hamburger/menu toggle button visible only on mobile that opens and closes the sidebar as a slide-in drawer from the left side of the screen.

quotes: On mobile screens, the left sidebar overlaps the dashboard content. The sidebar should be hidden or shown as a slide menu

acceptanceCriteria: On screens narrower than the md breakpoint, the sidebar is hidden by default and does not overlap any content
A visible hamburger/menu icon button appears in the top bar on mobile screens
Tapping the menu button slides the sidebar in from the left as a drawer overlay
Tapping the menu button again, or tapping outside the drawer, slides the sidebar back out and hides it
On desktop (md and above), the sidebar remains always visible in its original layout, unchanged

requirements.text: On mobile screens, the main content area must occupy the full width of the viewport when the sidebar is closed. Remove any left margin or offset that was previously reserved for the sidebar on small screens.

quotes: the main content should be full width

acceptanceCriteria: When the sidebar is closed on mobile, the main content stretches to full viewport width with no sidebar-sized gap or margin on the left
When the sidebar drawer is open on mobile, it overlays the content rather than pushing it aside
On desktop, the main content layout is unaffected

requirements.text: When the mobile sidebar drawer is open, add a semi-transparent dark backdrop overlay behind the drawer and on top of the main content. Tapping the backdrop should close the drawer.

quotes: The sidebar should be hidden or shown as a slide menu

acceptanceCriteria: A semi-transparent overlay appears over the main content when the sidebar drawer is open on mobile
Tapping the overlay closes the sidebar drawer
The overlay is not present on desktop

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui/
Desktop sidebar layout must remain unchanged
All changes must be confined to AdminLayout.tsx and related layout styles
nonGoals: Adding new navigation items to the sidebar
Changing sidebar content or styling beyond mobile responsiveness
